Listenable Class Reference

#include <Listenable.h>

Inheritance diagram for Listenable:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A listenable object is an object that supports registering listeners for certain events.

Among others, pointer targets like components, widgets, etc, as well as images are listenable.

See also:
EventTarget

Component

Window

Image

Member Function Documentation

void appendListener (  Listener *  listener  ) 
 

Adds a listener at the end of the listeners of this listenable object.

Appended listeners are called last.

Parameters:
listener The listener to be added.
Warning:
Listeners are auto-deleting when they are not listening to any listenable object anymore. So you should not hold any references to them and you should not manually delete them.

const ArrayList<Listener>& getListeners (   ) 
 

Returns all currently registered listeners.

Listeners are called in the order they have been appended.

Returns:
The listeners.

void* getModel (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the application (or game) defined data.

Typically, there is an object that contains application data that corresponds to this graphical element. This object (or raw data) is stored here. Glaziery will not perform any operation on it, but you can use it to identify application objects for given event targets (such as components).

Returns:
The application (or game) defined data.

SkinData* getSkinData (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the skin specific settings and other skin data.

The skin data is managed by the skin. If you want to implement a skin independent application (or game), do not use this object outside the skin. However, if you know which skin is in use and you require to read or write special property, you may cast this object to the respective type. This object may be NULL, if the skin does not need to store any data.

Returns:
The skin specific settings and other skin data.
Note:
If the object is not null when the component is destroyed, then the skin data is automatically destroyed.

void GlazieryObject::destructor (  void *  model  )  [static, inherited]
 

Destructor function for the setModel() method, when setting a model that is a glaziery object itself.

Parameters:
model The model to be destroyed.
See also:
setModel()

void insertListener (  int  position,
Listener *  listener
) 
 

Inserts a listener at a given position in the listeners of this listenable object.

Parameters:
position The 0-indexed position of the listener.
listener The listener to be added.
Warning:
Listeners are auto-deleting when they are not listening to any listenable object anymore. So you should not hold any references to them and you should not manually delete them.

void prependListener (  Listener *  listener  ) 
 

Adds a listener at the beginning of the listeners of this listenable object.

Prepended listeners are called first.

Parameters:
listener The listener to be added.
Warning:
Listeners are auto-deleting when they are not listening to any listenable object anymore. So you should not hold any references to them and you should not manually delete them.

void removeListener (  Listener *  listener  ) 
 

Removes a listener from the list of listeners and then deletes it, if it is no longer used.

Parameters:
listener The listener to be removed and deleted.
Warning:
Listeners are auto-deleting when they are not listening to any listenable object anymore. So you should not hold any references to them.

void setModel (  void *  model,
void(*  modelDestructor)(void *model) = NULL
)  [inherited]
 

Sets the application (or game) defined data.

Typically, there is an object that contains application data that corresponds to this graphical element. This object (or raw data) is stored here. Glaziery will not perform any operation on it, but you can use it to identify application objects for given event targets (such as components).

Parameters:
model The application (or game) defined data.
modelDestructor An optional static method that is called, whenever the glaziery object is destroyed or when a new model is set. Specify this function only, if the model must be destroyed by this glaziery object, i.e. the object "owns" the model. If the model is a glaziery object itself, you may use the GlazieryObject::destructor() function.
See also:
destructor()

virtual void setSkinData (  SkinData *  skinData  )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Sets the skin specific settings and other skin data.

The skin data is managed by the skin. If you want to implement a skin independent application (or game), do not use this object outside the skin. However, if you know which skin is in use and you require to read or write special property, you may cast this object to the respective type. This object may be NULL, if the skin does not need to store any data.

Parameters:
skinData The skin specific settings and other skin data.
Note:
If the object is not null when the component is destroyed, then the skin data is automatically destroyed.

Any previously set skin data is automatically destroyed.

Reimplemented in Component.

The string representation.
